title: Can we talk about Thornmail for a second?
body:
So, yeah.. that Thornmail item that has existed forever.. kind of sucks balls.

Why?  It is completely countered by 1 lifesteal item.  Please add a passive to Thornmail applies Grievous Wounds when it applies reflect damage.

Thanks.

replies.body: https://embed.gyazo.com/592489ee47272b1a374946e5d745212c.gif  "Sucks balls" hehe
Did you miss the 1 lifesteal item part?

Well first of all I had Warlords, which is basically a life steal item at ~half hp.

And adcs dont get life steal until they finished at least 4+ items. So a cheap ass item, thats supposed to either do damage or negate lifesteal, is bad because... it negates lifesteal once the adc has some?

> And adcs dont get life steal until they finished at least 4+ items. 

Generally, you adjust your build depending on the game.

If you are worried about dealing with a Thornmail Malphite, consider building along the lines of:
{{item:3006}} {{item:3031}} ({{item:3046}} or {{item:3085}} ) {{item:1053}} {{item:3035}}

Whats funny is that I had {{item:3031}} {{item:3085}} and a {{item:3036}} there and still crit the Malphite with only 2 armor items + boots for around 150 or less lol. I see no reason to buff Thornmail/tanks if stuff like that is possible.
I agree that adcs have low actual counter"play" since all they really do is auto attack but... Whats the counterplay to a tank literally just existing and killing you for doing what youre supposed to?

Generally, you have your teammates deal with them if you cannot.  If Malphite only had Armor/Health items, a mage would tear through him pretty quickly while your support helps to peel.

If your team was full AD due to a screw up in champion select, your team is being punished for that mistake.

Being punished for the mistakes of others in-game can be rather aggravating, but draft is a very influential part of the game.

A week or so ago in normals I was in JG as {{champion:24}} and the opposing team comp was all ad champs (and soraka as support).

Well I ended up building ~300 armor and became nigh unkillable.  It was amazing.

> [{quoted}](name=sc2salt,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Hvn0GEnc,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-12-09T13:51:03.972+0000)

> Yep, it's pretty useless item. Life steal and **magic resist** makes thornmail useless.

The latter is an oft overlooked point. 

Even at base MR an ADC is going to "secretly" reduce a lot of potency from Thornmail, which makes it look even "better" than it actually is - and it doesn't even look "good" to begin with. Unless you are playing Rammus, for yourself AND your team it is always better to pick Frozen Heart or Randiun's Omen over Thornmail. Thornmail is a "selfish" item that doesn't even serve you all that well.

Thornmail is a good option if you are trying to duel/dive the ADC.  Primarily, it greatly reduces their sustain so they can't just lifesteal through your damage.

Generally, it isn't just going to kill them through reflected damage though.

> [{quoted}](name=EndlessSorcerer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Hvn0GEnc,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-12-09T14:13:33.598+0000)

> 
> Generally, it isn't just going to kill them through reflected damage though.

By proxy, so do {{item:3110}} and  {{item:3143}}.

It is a difference between:

* Reducing their damage and surviving longer
* Reflecting their damage and killing them quicker

Depending on the situation, one option may be better than the others.

Alternatively, you can easily build Frozen Heart and Thornmail to reduce the damage they deal while you survive and to make them avoid focusing you.

It's not meant to completely negate lifesteal.

It's fine as it is.
Really?  When was the last time you ever saw someone buy Thornmail in a serious game?

Me. But to be fair I was playing Rammus giving double dip damage, and the poor recipient of my attention was a Kogmaw.

It was OK.

You can't buff thornmail. You just can't. Reflect damage is a very toxic and cancerous mechanic in any game, let alone this game. 

I'm sure you never fought a fed rammus in the late game as a melee or ranged AD carry, but it is stupid. The fact that you kill yourself by attacking is not cool. 

If you ask me I think thornmail should be reworked into a pure defensive powerhouse against physical damage. Something like removing the reflect entirely, adding 50 armor, and a new passive that reduces all physical damage taken by 10%-15%

First of all, Rammus is not a proper indicator of the strength of Thornmail.  He is a very unique case because he can:

1. Force you to auto him.

2. Damage you every attack with his W (or whatever spell it is).

Thornmail on him amplifies his damage because as it is, you HAVE to attack him for him to deal any meaningful damage.

Name one other champion besides Rammus that treads the fine line of "Lol Thornmail is garbage right now but soooo close to being game breaking".  Malphite?  Poppy?  Taric?

Any champion that scales on armor will love it, but not for the reflect.  It is the most efficient gold item for pure armor.

Any ADC can completely nullify Thornmail *at any stage of the game* with {{item:3139}} .

MR?  Check.  Lifesteal?  Check.  Congrats, you have just completely turned the anti-carry into a health pot.  The ONLY way Thornmail could ever be useful (outside of Rammus) is if it applied Grievous Wounds.
But then they'd have to increase the cost, and it's already a hard buy. The combine cost is like 1250 isn't it? Totally absurd.

I don't think they would need to change the price.

Morello is 2900 and it applies grievous, plus 20% CDR and a fuck ton of AP + lost chapter is like stupid strong in lane.

In the sense that it's a buff to the item I think they would be forced to on principle. I mean they can look at the item's winrates and maybe if it's too low, they can add it in as a buff instead of a change-- but the winrates are most likely skewed because Rammus. Honestly it's just meant to counter on-hit champions and not be a legit item. I agree it's weak and feels awful to buy, but probably for different reasons. 

Maybe instead of it being Cloth + Chain Vest + 1250 gold, it can be Chain Vest x2 + 750 gold. 

The amount of armor doesn't change, the price doesn't change. But sitting on 1250 gold makes you weak. Stats don't mean anything; what matters is stats at time. This way, you'd have more armor earlier. It would be a small buff. 

Adding GW to it... just being realistic, I don't ever see that happening. What I could see happening is maybe making a new tank GW item. But the tank's job really isn't to apply GW or deal damage, it's just to soak damage and disrupt the enemy team with CC or diving. Not to shit on your thread though. Just my two cents.

I honestly think thornmail should be removed from the game. 

Tank main opinion on the item (it's my own opinion though): thornmail punishes champions for fighting tanks correctly. Tanks are weak to sustained damage and the items meant to counter it are about making it happen slower (Omen, heart). Thornmail however punishes the opponent for a continued stream of damage that's meant to whittle down the tank. 

"But thornmail is weak right now!"

Yeah it is and it can't be strong because of how it punishes you for fighting tanks correctly. If thornmail was good enough to be core on every tank build, then tanks would have no counter (well I guess it would be sustained magic damage that would counter them then. But sustained magic damage is rare and hard to balance). 

Omen and heart don't punish people from fighting tanks correctly, they just make it harder.

I for one am just fine with Thornmail being in the game.

It isn't too strong and...

It helps in ARAM when I'm {{champion:86}} VS like four marksmen on the enemy team.
I just feel that it holds stuff back.

Holds what back? You mean it holds back ADCs from wrecking tanks?

In that case yeah. I've no disagreement there. But it does have its niche.
Omen and heart are already there to help fight against ADCs as tanks. Thornmail however literally punishes your opponent for playing right.

True, but then you have many complaints of marksmen 1v5ing your team, and that the tanks need help. 

What many don't get is that the only reason the marksmen can do all this is because they get peeled for.

But you gotta admit getting whaled on by a bunch of ADCs on ARAM isn't fun.
How about no? I dont want tanks being dominant this is what assassins and mages are for to oneshot the adc with their burst

I'll pop in here and say what I usually do about Thorn.

It shouldn't even be a Tank item.  Tank gear should be about helping your team directly or indirectly.  That can be with auras, with slows, with slow burn damage in an AoE, or even just a bunch of CDR to help you spam your CC more often.

Thron shouldn't be a Tank item.  It should be a *Diver* item.  It should help give tanky champions and edge over that Marksmen they just jumped on.  To that end, allow me to suggest something completely different.

{{item:1031}} {{item:1029}} {{item:1043}}.

Grants armor, attack speed, 40 magic damage OnHit, and-
**Unique passive:** Your basic attacks apply stacks of Gored to enemy units, stacking up to eight times.  Melee attacks apply two stacks per hit.
**Unique passive:** For each stack of Gored on an enemy unit, you reflect (percentage) of the physical damage they deal (pre-mitigation) as magic damage.

Clean, simple, and most importantly interactive.  The problem with Thorn is that you don't have to do *anything* for it to mess someone up.  That's why it must be so weak.  But by adding in the requirement to actually interact with champions attacking you, suddenly there's room for counter-play.  Don't let Irelia jump on you and you won't have your damage reflected.  By adding OnHit damage into the mix, this new Thorn also helps to make you more of a threat even when you *aren't* being attacked, unlike live Thorn.

With the addition of Knight's Vow and Deadman's Plate to the game I would argue that there are ample armor options in the game for Vanguards, Juggernauts, and Wardens alike.  Divers could really use some itemization tailored to them.

It should not let you just sit back and have adcs kill themselves no matter what they build, it'd be unhealthy. Having said that, slight buff in % of damage reflected (add another 5%) could be appropriate, but MR+lifesteal countering it is how life should be. If you really want grevious wounds, you can get an appropriate item in addition.

I don't think Thornmail should provide Grievous. It could cripple champions which are not ADCs but rely on sustain. Champions like Vladimir, Swain, or Mundo. It is bullshit because most of those champions are AP yet they would be countered by a pure armor item. Sorta like Anivia and Karthus are currently "countered" by Randuin's Omen.

If you really want Thornmail to be a counter to lifesteal, a better solution would be "Reduce the lifesteal from enemies attacking this champion by X%" This way, ADCs are countered, but not casters that rely on sustain (especially those that are AP)
That wouldn't affect AP champs unless they were auto-ing the Thornmail champ.  It would only apply GW when it deals damage form the reflect.
i would like 2 thromnails. one with GW and one that negates critical strikes by half( or insert balanced number here). this way adc would finally have some fkn counterplay in mid/late game
The first is how Thornmail should already be, the second could be some really late game item that builds out of Randuins.

I've never really understood the whole 'It's countered by lifesteal items!' line. 

Isn't Thornmail the counter item? You are trying to make THEIR items less valuable by buying Thornmail. Obviously the purpose of Thornmail is not to make it so no auto attacker can ever survive an encounter with you because they kill themselves, that would be horrible. The point is to reduce the effectiveness of their build by weakening their damage and sustain.

I think people see that effect and just expect to much. Buying one item should not allow you to auto win every encounter with auto attack centric heroes via making attacking their opponent a losing strategy.

can we stop saying thornmail is countered by lifesteal when in fact lifesteal is countered by thornmail?

Tanks shouldn't be allowed to 2v1 an ADC + Soraka, that's not fair at all when tanks can already 1v2 mages, supports and assassins

Even more important: Thornmail and sunfire cape exist to lessen sustain and have damage that adds up. Stop acting as if thornmail is a damage item that's meant to make ADCs literally kill themselves.
the point is to force the enemy to buy a lifesteal item imo
